title: Talon's Q
body: Does Talon's Q have to be undogable? I mean, a skillshot should be something that can miss, this thing cannot. Ahri's Q returns to her as Talon's Q does but it goes in a straight line, while Talon's Q is shot in a cone. During the laning phase that makes him too strong and only later, he gets weaker, because of how item reliant he is. I propose that Talon's Q would be changed into a real skillshot so that it can be dodged, also then he can be buffed. I prefer when champions have something that they can miss or that can be dodged. If they are too point and click then what is the point.

You do realize the targeted Q makes him weaker, right? It makes his single 575 range engage (shorter range than Ahri's Q and charm) a linear dash that makes it easy to CC him because he'll always dash in a line to your direction, making lux binds and ahri charms super easy to land.

I can't believe you're even comparing Ahri to him when Ahri is a hard counter of talon just like Lux, Xerath, and Velkoz. Any mage with a linear CC counters him since his Q is his only engage, he's squishy, and being easy to kite means he loses hard after being peeled off his Q.

If anything, I'd be OK with his W being like the orianna ball where he throws it and then can reactivate within a short period of time when they can return.
Sorry about confusion. I meant his W. I mix those things.
Talon's Q is a linear dash or melee attack. His W is in a cone and is a skillshot too. Are you mixing things up..? He CAN miss his W or rake which is what I think you are talking about.
